hero.name: Saeed Ahmad
hero.tagline: Harvard J.D. ’24 — Visiting Fellow, Harvard Law School Religious Freedom Clinic; Former Clerk to Justice Shah, Supreme Court of Pakistan; ex-Client Advisor, Louis Vuitton (Beverly Hills).
hero.currently: Visiting Fellow, HLS Religious Freedom Clinic

about.bio: Saeed Ahmad is a Pakistani-American recent graduate of Harvard Law School, and was a recipient of the Dean’s Award for Community Leadership. He works as an attorney in New York City, while also serving as a Visiting Fellow at the Harvard Law School Religious Freedom Clinic. Saeed hails from the city of Corona in Southern California, earned 3 AA degrees from Norco College, & graduated with a B.A. degree in Psychology from UCLA in 2020. Before law school, he worked as a Client Advisor at the Louis Vuitton Flagship Store on Rodeo Drive. His tenure in law school encompassed working as a summer clerk at the Supreme Court of Pakistan, a boutique commercial litigation firm in Los Angeles, and at a corporate law firm in New York City. Additionally, his involvements on campus spanned the Harvard Association for Law & Business, J.D. Admissions Fellow Program, Committee For Sports & Entertainment Law, & research focused on IP/Copyright law in the realm of fashion. He has also served as an editor on the Harvard Business Law Review.
